article.headline: Long Beach State 57, Maryland-Baltimore County 53
article.story: CATONSVILLE, Md. (AP) -- Aaron Nixon scored a season-high 23 points and Long Beach State halted a three-game losing streak with a 57-53 victory over Maryland-Baltimore County on Sunday. Reserve Mark Dawson added 11 points for the 49ers (3-4), who took command with a 16-2 run midway through the second half, erasing UMBC's 37-30 lead. Tom Young scored a career-high 17 points for the Retrievers (3-5), who have dropped three of four. Mike Housman's layup finished a 12-3 UMBC run that produced a 37-30 lead with 13:28 remaining in the second half. But Nixon nailed a 3-pointer from the left side, igniting the decisive burst for Long Beach. Nixon had seven points during the surge and Sterling Byrd capped it with a driving basket. Young tallied five consecutive points to put UMBC ahead 50-49 with 3:36 left, but the 49ers took the lead for good on Dominique Ricks' tip-in 15 seconds later. Nixon then hit a one-handed floater and converted a three-point play and Long Beach led 56-50 with 34.3 seconds to go. Matt Spadafora's right-side baseline jumper with 1:19 left in the first half gave UMBC a 23-22 halftime lead. The 49ers were held to eight first-half field goals, and the Retrievers shot only 10-for-31 from the field.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
